intro: Mycaranthes farinosa, commonly known as the farinose mycaranthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in composite inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. This species is relatively rare and is found in specific regions of southern Africa.
